API Reference

This page provides a detailed reference for all the functions available in the Neuro-Analyst OS library.

neuro_analyst.io.load(filepath: str) → Raw | None[source]

Smartly loads EEG data from various file formats.

This function automatically detects the file type based on its extension and uses the appropriate MNE-Python function to load the data.

Parameters:

filepath (str) – The absolute or relative path to the EEG data file.

Returns:

An MNE Raw object if successful, otherwise None.

Return type:

mne.io.Raw | None

Supported Formats:

  • .edf (European Data Format)

  • .bdf (BioSemi Data Format)

  • .fif (Elekta Neuromag)

  • .set (EEGLAB)

neuro_analyst.plotting.plot_evoked(epochs: Epochs, **kwargs)[source]

Creates a butterfly plot of evoked potentials.

Parameters:

epochs (mne.Epochs) – The epoched EEG data.

neuro_analyst.plotting.plot_ica_components(ica: ICA, **kwargs)[source]

Generates a standard plot of ICA component topographies.

Parameters:

ica (mne.preprocessing.ICA) – The fitted ICA object.

neuro_analyst.plotting.plot_psd(raw: Raw, compare_with: Raw | None = None, **kwargs)[source]

Plots the Power Spectral Density (PSD) of a Raw object.

Parameters:

  • raw (mne.io.Raw) – The raw EEG data.

  • compare_with (mne.io.Raw, optional) – Another raw object to overlay for comparison. Defaults to None.

neuro_analyst.reporting.generate_html_report(original_raw, cleaned_raw, config, bad_channels_found, ica_results)[source]

Generates an interactive HTML report comparing raw and cleaned data.

neuro_analyst.utils.get_default_config()[source]

Returns the default configuration for the cleaning pipeline.
